DataElement.preferredName: New Primary Malignant Neoplasm Central Nervous System Germ Cell Tumor Diagnosis Ind-2
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator related to new diagnosis of a unique group of rare tumors of the central nervous system that affect mainly children and adolescents (e.g., Germinoma, Embryonal Carcinoma, Yolk Sac Tumor (Endodermal Sinus Tumor), Choriocarcinoma, Mature Teratoma, Immature Teratoma, Teratoma with Malignant Transformation and Mixed Germ Cell Tumors).

DataElementConcept.preferredName: New Primary Malignant Neoplasm Central Nervous System Germ Cell Tumor Diagnosis
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to very recently determined diagnosis of a unique group of rare tumors of the central nervous system that affect mainly children and adolescents (e.g., Germinoma, Embryonal Carcinoma, Yolk Sac Tumor (Endodermal Sinus Tumor), Choriocarcinoma, Mature Teratoma, Immature Teratoma, Teratoma with Malignant Transformation and Mixed Germ Cell Tumors) restricted to the site of origin.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Having no previous example or precedent or parallel; of a kind not seen before.:A malignant tumor at the original site of growth.

Concepts.definition: Having no previous example or precedent or parallel; of a kind not seen before.
A malignant tumor at the original site of growth.

Property.preferredName: Central Nervous System Germ Cell Tumor Diagnosis
Property.preferredDefinition: Germ Cell Tumors of the CNS constitute a unique class of rare tumors that affect mainly children and adolescents. Their histopathological and biological profile largely corresponds to that of homologous germ cell neoplasms arising in the gonads and in other extragonadal sites. Germ Cell Tumors of the CNS include: Germinoma, Embryonal Carcinoma, Yolk Sac Tumor (Endodermal Sinus Tumor), Choriocarcinoma, Mature Teratoma, Immature Teratoma, Teratoma with Malignant Transformation and Mixed Germ Cell Tumors. (Adapted from WHO.):The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.

Concepts.longName: Central Nervous System Germ Cell Tumor
Concepts.definition: A unique group of rare tumors of the central nervous system that affect mainly children and adolescents. Their morphologic and biologic profile corresponds to that of homologous germ cell tumors that arise in the gonads and in other extragonadal sites. Representative examples include: germinoma, embryonal carcinoma, yolk sac tumor, choriocarcinoma, and teratoma.

The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

ReferenceDocuments.name: Does patient have newly diagn
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have newly diagnosed localized primary CNS NGGCT?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the patient newly diagnosed with localized primary CNS NGGCT of the suprasellar and/or pineal region by pathology and/or serum or CSF elevation of AFP above institutional normal or > 10 ng/mL or hCGB > 100 mIU/mL?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the patient newly diagnosed with localized primary CNS NGGCT of the suprasellar and/or pineal region by pathology and/or serum or CSF elevation of AFP above institutional normal or > 10 ng/mL or hCGB > 100 mIU/mL as confirmed by Rapid Central Marker Screening Review on APEC14B1-CNS?
